investigation.title: Substrate Matters: Ionic Silver Alters Lettuce Growth, Nutrient Uptake, and Root Microbiome in a Hydroponics System
investigation.description: Ionic silver (Ag+) is being investigated as a residual biocide for use in NASA spacecraft potable water systems on future crewed missions. This water will be used to irrigate future spaceflight crop production systems.

project.funding: This research was made possible by Center Innovation Funding (CIF) from NASA’s Science and Technology Mission Directorate (STMD) to Kennedy Space Center (KSC) Exploration and Research Technology (ER and T) Division.

publications.title: Substrate Matters: Ionic Silver Alters Lettuce Growth, Nutrient Uptake, and Root Microbiome in a Hydroponics System.
publications.summary: Substrate Matters: Ionic Silver Alters Lettuce Growth, Nutrient Uptake, and Root Microbiome in a Hydroponics System. — 10.3390/microorganisms12030515
